bibl.title: Letter from E.F. McEwan to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1941

div1.p: McEwan thanks Hench for the copy of his yellow fever article and makes reference to Hench's mother.

div1.head: Letter from E.F. McEwan to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1941

opener.dateline:
Mrs. William I. McEwan
5534 Kentucky Avenue
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

div1.p:
I appreciate your
sending me the autographed
copy of your splendid address
on Yellow Fever, and I feel
very proud of you. You
have certainly made good
in your chosen profession,
and all of us who love you
feel that you deserve every
honor that has come to you.

Your mother seems quite
contented with her funny,
ancient little colored cook!

With love to Mary
and you, I am,
